name: UncleRon
0:
”Alexa, ask uncle ron to tell me about Chief Inspiration Officer.”
”Alexa, ask uncle ron to tell me about Thousand Dollar Coffee.”
”Alexa, ask uncle ron to play the latest update.”
skdetail:
Rated: Guidance Suggested. This skill contains: dynamic content.
Invocation Name: uncle ron
Developer Terms of Use
des:
Uncle Ron is here with business and life fortune cookies built on 30 years of success and failure selling $6 billion dollars through retail, infomercials, commercials and digital platforms. He is the relative you want to visit.

Enable this skill then say: 
 "Alexa, ask Uncle Ron to play the latest episode."

More phrases you can use:

First say, "Alexa, launch Uncle Ron."

Once the Skill is open, say:

"Tell me about Ron Lynch." 
"Tell me about the Chief Inspiration Officer."
"Tell me about Thousand Dollar Coffee." 
"$1000 Cup of Coffee."
" Tell me about The Marketing Mercenary."
"Tell me about The Marketing Mercenary Course."
"Tell me about Thinkership Coaching."
"Tell me about Thinkership Coach.”
"Tell me about DIY Creative and Strategic Brief."
"Tell me about Creative Brief.”
"Play the latest episode."

Discovered by famed independent director Robert Altman in 1987, he was cast with Jeff Daniels and Peter Gallagher in Herman Wouks “The Caine Mutiny Court Martial” which was a CBS Sunday Night Movie in the US and theatrically released in Europe. The SAG card in hand, he grabbed bit roles for a few years in films with Shirley MacLaine, River Phoenix (“DogFight”), and Jeff Bridges.

This led to screenwriting of over 12 films while he worked his way up in the grocery business to be an Operational Director for several Thriftway stores in the PNW. Awarded Grocer of the Year in 1995, he soon left the business to pursue a successful career in Infomercials where he aided in the launch of GoPro, Eagle One Car products, The Ultimate Chopper, The Total Trolley, Samsung Vacuum PowerBots, and over 70 household brands.

His documentary “Polé Polé” chronicles the climb of Rececca Dufek as she attempts to summit Mt. Kilimanjaro while overcoming 30 plus brain tumors from the disease Neurofibromytosis Type 2 (NF2).

His second film “City of Songs” chronicles Rock Guitar Legend Charlie Sexton and Percussion aficionado Michael Blair as they curate a band in Lulea Sweden, record an albums worth of music and perform live on instruments made of ice and a massive igloo complete with live audience.

Author of 5 books, Ron is Founder of Intellihelp charity, feeding American families during the pandemic which spread to over 13 countries.

As an inventor he holds patents for medical devices, the Korb handheld educational computer company and NFTYLock which ties human DNA to NFT pairs securing wallets, verifying transactions, titles and identity tools.

Uncle Ron is a different duck and brings stories of movie stars, business trainwrecks and even legendary pitchman Billy Mays to life with humor, insight, tension and revelations you can apply.

Learn more: www.ronnylynch.com

About Uncle Ron. 
He is a failed child actor, it’s funny and true. Yet, he went on to a career as a retailer, business management expert, author, inventor, investor, commercial producer, film maker, family man and mentor. He has personally generated over 6 billion in revenue and had a hand in many consumer brands. He will tell you that most everything that he has learned is from the many failures, risks and follies along the way. He is a storyteller. Yet the stories are not about him, they are for you. Meet Ron Lynch, your newly discovered Uncle.
